awards.title: Professor John Fitzpatrick Prize
awards.description:
This prize was established in 2013 by a bequest from the Department of Mechanical and
Manufacturing Engineering in memory of the late Professor John Fitzpatrick, former Head of the
School of Engineering and Chair of Mechanical Engineering. The prize is awarded annually to the
best student in the M.A.I. (St.) degree as determined by the court of examiners

awards.description: Every year a select number of graduating students are awarded the gold medal of academic merit. The gold medal is one of the most prestigious accolades a student completing their BAI at Trinity College Dublin can be awarded.

awards.description: Selected to speak at the opening keynote at SAP TechEd 2015 based on data analytics work carried out on Indiana state road incident data using the SAP predictive analytics framework. You can watch my section of the keynote here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mozBUKr3cBw

Together we were able to merge our skill sets to design a solution and take third in a highly competitive competition.

projects.title: CubeSat Networks: Balancing Power with Satellite-to-Ground Data Throughput
projects.description:
Invited to present a IAC '17 and Small Satellite Conference '17

Abstract:
CubeSats are small satellite platforms which have significantly reduced the cost of access to low Earth orbit over the past decade. Recent CubeSat missions have demonstrated the platform’s ability to form in-orbit networks. CubeSat Network (CSN) missions enable low-cost applications in coordinated sensing and low-bandwidth communications.
This work addresses a trade-off unique to CSNs. CubeSat satellite-to-ground (S2G) communication requires high levels of energy consumption to achieve data rates in the order of kilobytes per second. In comparison, CubeSats are capable of more energy efficient satellite-to-satellite (S2S) communication at rates an order of magnitude above those of S2G communication. This asymmetry underpins this work’s trade-off of interest, that of CSN power use against S2G data throughput.
Relevant areas of prior art are examined and specialized Medium Access Control (MAC) and routing protocols are proposed. This work’s proposed protocols are developed alongside a simulation of a hypothetical CSN mission using the open-source network simulator, OMNeT++. Proposed MAC protocol energy saving features are shown to decrease CSN energy consumption without a reduction in S2G throughput. This work’s proposed routing protocol introduces the energy sensitive election of a CubeSat dedicated to performing S2G communication. This election approach is shown to reduce the energy consumption of previously “over-worked” CubeSats. Additional adjustments to route discovery behaviour are required to ensure this approach does not reduce the overall energy efficiency of S2G communication.

projects.title: Trinity Space Society
projects.description: I'd been working hard to grow my network in the Irish space industry. I wanted to reach researchers and companies to really get a feel for where I could fit into the industry. It was frustrating to talk to so many people who were disconnected from the larger Irish space community. I felt if only I could find that one central connection then I would find all the information and advice I desired. In reality there's really no one out there enabling Irish university students and graduates to engage in the Irish and European space industry. As such I decided to make a start by founding the Trinity Space Society. A society within my home university dedicated to promoting interest and activity in the all aspects of space science, technology and exploration. There are amazing opportunities out there for Irish university students to learn, develop and explore. I'm on a mission to create a thriving community for fellow students and graduates.

projects.title: Road To Discovery: Powered By Esteem
projects.description: As a final legacy project for my time at the University of Notre Dame I began working with fellow ESTEEM students to raise funds for Niemann Pick Type-C research in association with the Ara Parseghian Medical Research Foundation. We rode over 350 miles to raise money to fund research for a rare and deadly disease. I designed and implemented all elements of the venture's website. We raise close to $140,000 for the cause helping bring research closer to finding a cure for Niemann Pick Type-C.

profile_positions.location: Noordwijk aan Zee, South Holland, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Columbus Systems Development - Development of the next-generation Columbus Data Management Infrastructure (CDMI) as part of the ‘Columbus Modernization’ initiative

Systems Engineering - Management and support of ISS Ground Segment interface revisions as well as assessment of the impacts of future utilization on existing Columbus interfaces

Ground Segment Support - Maintaining and expanding the ISS Erasmus Support Facility (ESF) in support of Orion ESM and European Robotic Arm (ERA) operations

International Partner Interfaces - ESA NASA Ground Segment Coordination Working Group (ENCWG), NASA Avionics Software Telecon (AST), Multilateral Avionics and Software Control Board (MASCB)

Coordination with Industry - GS Engineering Control Board (GS ECB), Cornerstone 1 Contract Change Board (CCB)

Business Development - Pursuing technology development through programs such as ARTES AT and GSTP
profile_positions.title: Ground Segment System Engineer - DLR Integrated Team

profile_positions.description:
Team Management - Managed an inter-disciplinary team of 12 persons across multiple key projects at EAC

Customer & Partner Relations - Coordination and collaboration with various ESA, NASA and industry parties

Process Development - Creation and optimization of the unit’s existing systems and operational processes

Data Driven Team Management - Development of customized tools which support reporting and analysis of the unit’s work

Strategic Development -Collaboration with upper management and key partners on the unit’s strategic plan

Technology Development - AR/VR steering board member. Supporting the application of modern technologies
profile_positions.title: Ground Segment and Infrastructure Unit Lead - DLR Integrated Team

profile_positions.description:
As part of the infrastructure team at team I have worked, and continue to work on a broad range of areas relating to Training, Operations, Simulation and Technology Development. My primary role is to support EAC's Lead Ground Controller however, I also worked on an as-needed basis for a number of different projects and groups at EAC.

Network Engineering - Full stack
Software Engineering - Python, Perl, C++, Shell, Javascript
IT / Data Security Development - Encryption, PKI, Authorization, Authentication, Auditing
ISS Ground Segment - Payload integration and operations support
Robotics - Video engineering incl. dynamic trans-coding (GST, Nginx)
Future Exploration Activities - Advanced MCS concepts, Lunar analogue development
Systems Administration - Linux (Primary), Windows (Secondary)
Technical Documentation - Technology strategy, Security management, Procedures

Aside from my core duties I also host and manage the ESA-internal 'EAC Podcast' which I hope to bring to the general public in 2019.
profile_positions.title: Infrastructure and Ground Segment Engineer with Telespazio-Vega

profile_positions.description:
My primary project concerned the formation of multi-mission control room infrastructure. I also assisted in organizational structure and EAC security development.

Learning:
Ground Segment Technology
Mission Control Systems
Configuration Management
IT Security Best Practices
Systems Administration
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description:
This short but demanding internship  was a direct continuation of my 2015 role. The team, organization and environment was unchanged but the workload was vastly different from the my highly research oriented work during my previous internship at AWS. 

I was tasked with developing a full end to end service which fulfilled the needs of various differing customers. The service addressed a core operational need within the organization. I designed and delivered this service in this time frame with time to spare and features delivered beyond the original scope.

Learned:
Operations Automation
Python for Data Analysis and REST API Development
Logging and Monitoring Best Practices
Customer Driven Service Design
Large Scale Systems Development
profile_positions.title: Systems Engineering Intern, Edge Service Operations

profile_positions.description:
Accompanying my ESTEEM capstone thesis I spent time with Trek10 assisting in software development, sales, marketing and positioning. 

My contributions to software development at Trek10 focused primarily on cloud-event driven computing and container based architectures within the AWS portfolio. I focused mainly on AWS Lambda and the open-source Serverless Framework. One notable example being the a project referred to as 'lambda-clock'. I independently designed and implemented lambda-clock which allows for a more fine-grained scheduling of lambda function execution.

Learned:
NodeJS
Docker
Microservice Architecture Development
Serverless Development
Advanced AWS Architecture Development
Rapid Software Prototyping
profile_positions.title: ESTEEM Thesis Intern

profile_positions.description:
I designed and developed a performance analysis suite for bench-marking file systems on the massively distributed cache machine fleet of the Cloudfront CDN. Data is used to inform design decisions for file system modification and implementation. 

Beyond performance analysis I developed a strong understanding of operational tasks performed on the Cloudfront and Route53 fleets which directly impact to experience of end-users. 

Learned:
Advanced Linux Filesystems Properties
Automated Performance Profiling
AWS Edge Technologies
Linux Scripting
profile_positions.title: Systems Engineering Intern, Edge Services, Cloudfront Route 53

profile_positions.description: Implemented Jenkins MSBuild server to aid with ongoing development. I worked largely with .NET build scripts which was a new challenge but satisfying once testing and build workflow were running smoothing launching from the Jenkins environment.
profile_positions.title: Part-Time Development Intern

profile_positions.description:
Awarded Naughton REU fellowship
Research assistant at the Center for Research Computing. 
Supervisor: Dr. Paul Brenner
Project: Dynamic Provision of Custom Cluster Through OpenStack and HTCondor

Dr. Brenner set a high pace and I worked hard on rapidly building an understanding of both OpenStack and HTCondor. I began by building a virtual cloud on my laptop with OpenStack. This quickly transitioned to using several machines in ND academic compute cluster to develop my designs. I developed a basic scripting interface which would allow researchers to specify a Condor pool onto which to schedule jobs. The back-end could then make decisions about available capacity and if needs be use the micro-OpenStack cloud to provision resources on the fly for researchers.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
https://twitter.com/hashtag/ESAExplores?

https://www.esa.int/Our_Activities/Human_and_Robotic_Exploration/International_Space_Station/ESA_launches_new_podcast_for_Beyond_mission

An official public European Space Agency podcast "ESA Explores"

ESA Explores’ pilot season focuses on ESA astronaut Luca Parmitano’s Beyond mission to the International Space Station. The first episode, released today via all major podcast platforms, includes an interview with Luca himself during his final days of training at ESA’s Astronaut Centre (EAC) in Cologne, Germany.

volunteer_experiences.role: Small Satellite Project Group: Communications Lead
volunteer_experiences.description:
Coordinating communications for the Small Satellite Project Group (SSPG) requires the coordination of the group's social media presence and monthly newsletter. The role requires the that myself and my team of SSPG members stay continually up-to-date with major small satellite news on an international scale. Processing this content alone represents a considerable workload. However, our dedication to the industry makes light work of the information overload allowing us to identify daily content that fits SGAC's and the SSPG's core brand image and appeals to our central audience.

Learning:
Communications Editing
Social Media Management
Brand Development
Remote Leadership
Content Management

volunteer_experiences.role: Captain, Range Officer, Fitness coordinator, PRO
volunteer_experiences.description: DURC is the largest and most successful target shooting club in Ireland with over 600 members, a full time fully staffed range and 85% of the national records across multiple target shooting disciplines. I joined the club in early 2012 and rose through the ranks becoming a range officer and eventually the captain of the club in charge of all aspects of carrying for the membership, administration and management of the club's many assets. I learned a great deal about managing such a complicated organisation and dealing with the countless invested parties associated with DURC, including but not limited to the Irish DoJ, Gardai, TCD admin and National Target Shooting Association.
